Two European giants who have already punched their respective Club Wold Cup knockout stage spots, Juventus and Manchester City will meet in Orlando on Thursday night.

Juventus

Starting with Juventus, while the Old Lady might have only welcomed Igor Tudor to Turin back in March, they are certainly enjoying life under the former Lazio boss. Getting their Club World Cup adventure underway on June 19th with a 5-0 romp against Al-Ain, the Bianconeri were last seen putting in another dominant display. Cruising their way to a 4-1 victory against Wydad, Juve have breezed their way to a knockout stage ticket and haven’t had to get out of second gear. Signing off the 2024/25 campaign with an action-packed 3-2 win away at Venezia, Tudor’s camp have now won their previous four appearances across all competitions by an aggregate score of 14-3. Likewise, with their sights set on mounting a genuine title charge this summer, the Old Lady have suffered just a sole defeat since returning from March’s international break.

Juventus Team News

All still dealing with respective long-term knee injuries, Juventus will once again be without the trio of Arkadiusz Milik, Juan Cabal and Brazilian defender Bremer. Coming off the bench and bagging a maiden Club World Cup strike last weekend, Dusan Vlahovic could be handed a full recall.

Linked with a potential switch to Premier League outfit Nottingham Forest this summer, Timothy Weah should feature on Thursday night. Making his move to Turin a permanent one this summer, ex-Newcastle defender Lloyd Kelly could be handed a rest in Orlando.

Manchester City Team News

Shown a straight red card against Wydad on June 18th, England international Rico Lewis will once again miss out through suspension in Orlando. Making his Manchester City debut against Al-Ain earlier in the week, former Wolves defender Rayan Ait Nouri will be hoping to keep his spot at left-back.
